Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2010 02:27PM miloryder wrote: You have both family and support here.  The women on these pages have been through every aspect,every test,spent many.many days in the wiating game and are still here to offer help and a shoulder to whoever is in need,  Just take everyday one at a time.  Things seem to run in together and seem so overwhelming so it's important to keep things in perspective so you can think logical and rational  thoughts.  Ask your dr or surgeon if they can assign you a cancer buddy through the American Cancer Society.  Mine was very helpful and because I knew no one with any BC experiance was great help getting information from someone who knew,just like the women on these pages. I ws aloso give a book called "Just Get Me Through This'.  It was written by a survivour and her doctor when she was first dx.  It's funny in parts and the descriptions of terms and tests wer very good.  I actually took the book to the oncologist with me and we would write in the book for me.  All the things you mentioned all very doable.  PLease keep in touch and know that I am thinking and praying for you. You are a strong woman-always remember that.
Posts.Title: Surgery Tommorow : No family support Ondagrow Renrel
